conclusion: To express van der Waals constants a and b in terms of T_c and P_c, utilize properties of van der Waals equation near critical point.
Van der Waals equation: (P + a/V^2)(V - b) = RT
Critical point conditions: first and second derivatives of pressure with respect to volume are zero.
Differentiate van der Waals equation with respect to V at constant T and set derivative to zero at critical point.
Differentiate first derivative again with respect to V and set derivative to zero at critical point.
Solve for V_c: V_c/(V_c - b) = 3/2, V_c = 3b
Substitute V_c = 3b into first condition: 27RT_c = 8ab, a = 27/8 * RT_c/b
Substitute V_c = 3b into van der Waals equation at critical point.
Graph shows pressure-volume relationship with van der Waals equation.
